Opening wireless services to greater consumer choice will drive investment and innovation in the mobile marketplace, Julius Genachowski said in a statement Tuesday. They're being supplanted by these online social sites. And they're all selling ads, even the dating sites. The only surprise would have been if Facebook wasn't selling ads. What will be interesting is how they will police their ads. They don't want to get into a situation like Craigslist. scandal at one of Britain's sauciest tabloids. The aide, Andy Coulson , had edited News of the World, Britain's biggest-selling Sunday newspaper, until 2007 and shortly after was hired by David Cameron . Unfortunately continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in this role, Andy Coulson said in a statement. The resignation is a blow for David Cameron who had repeatedly backed Andy Coulson against calls for his resignation, saying earlier this week that everyone deserved a "second chance."
